title: Rewriting
text: Rewritting the expression will make it more convenient to use u-substitution. This can be rewritten as $$\int \left(2x^3+3x\right) {\left(x^4+3x^2\right)}^{-1} \,dx$$
speech: Rewritting the expression will make it more convenient to use u-substitution. This can be rewritten as  the integral of parentheses, 2 x cubed, plus 3 x  times parentheses, x to the fourth plus 3 x squared  to the negative 1 d x

title: Factoring
text: Alter du by factoring out the $$2$$ to obtain $$du=2\left(2x^3+3x\right) dx$$.

title: Dividing by $$2$$
text: Dividing both side by $$2$$ to obtain $$\frac{du}{2}=\left(2x^3+3x\right) dx$$
